title: Ray Guy, First N.F.L. Punter Named to the Hall of Fame, Dies at 72
description: A slender Georgia country boy with the outlaw Oakland Raiders of the 1970s, he proved that a punt could be a spectacle in its own right.
dc:creator: Alex Williams
media:description: Ray Guy of the Oakland Raiders, the first punter inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame, in action against the Philadelphia Eagles at the 1981 Super Bowl in New Orleans.
